subject: Mental Health
title: The Minnesota Starvation Experiment
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Minnesota Starvation Experiment usable.

hook.text: In 1944, healthy men volunteered to starve â€” and developed eating disorder symptoms.

buildup.text: Ancel Keys recruited 36 conscientious objectors to study the effects of semi-starvation.

discovery.text: The men became obsessed with food, anxious, depressed, and socially withdrawn.

twist.text: During refeeding, many binged uncontrollably â€” showing restriction itself triggers bingeing.

climax.text: The study proved that many anorexia symptoms are caused by starvation, not personality.

punchline.text: Starve anyone long enough and the mind unravels the same way.

quiz.question: What did the Minnesota Starvation Experiment demonstrate?
options: Starvation itself causes many eating disorder symptoms
Only people with weak wills develop eating disorders
